summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from August 6, 2019, discussing logistics for a planned search of Jeffrey Epstein's private island off St. Thomas. The warrant affidavit was being drafted by SDNY, with a tentative plan to execute the search starting around August 11-15, 2019.

connections.description: Both are FBI agents involved in planning the search of Epstein's island; S is providing instructions to M regarding the operation.
FBI colleagues coordinating availability for the search operation; U is informing M of travel plans that affect availability.

events.title: Planned FBI travel to Epstein's island
events.description: Tentative plan for FBI team to fly out on the FBI Q400 plane to Epstein's private island off St. Thomas to execute a search warrant.

events.title: Agent U's return from Hungary
events.description: Agent U states they leave for Hungary on Wednesday, August 14, and can help with the search if back before that date.

events.title: Planned FBI return travel
events.description: Tentative plan for the FBI search team to travel home after the 1-3 day search operation on Epstein's island.

keyFacts: SDNY was drafting a search warrant affidavit for Jeffrey Epstein's private island near St. Thomas as of August 6, 2019.
The FBI planned to execute the search warrant around August 11-15, 2019, using an FBI Q400 plane for travel.
The search was to be managed by the FBI's Evidence Response Team (ERT) and was expected to take 1-3 days.
The operation involved FBI Squad C-20, which handles Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking cases.
The email chain shows internal FBI coordination and planning for a significant investigative action shortly before Epstein's death in August 2019.
